intro: Leptophragma prostrata, commonly known as the prostrate leptophragma, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow, linear, and often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats.
